required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of CAR-T Cells Therapy for Patients With Relapsed and/or Refractory Central Nervous System Hematological Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial for the Safety and Efficacy of CAR-T Cells Therapy for Patients With the Central Nervous System Involvement of Relapsed and/or Refractory B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia or B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: A Study of CAR-T Cells Therapy for Patients With Relapsed and/or Refractory Central Nervous System Hematological Malignancies

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, single-center study. This study is indicated for relapsed or refractory central nervous system CD19+ B-cell hematological malignancies, including acute lymphoblastic leukemia and B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. The selections of dose levels and the numberof subjects are based on clinical trialsof similar foreign products. Two groups of patients will be enrolled, 36 in eachgroup. Primary objective is to explore the safety, main consideration is dose-related safety.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.measure: B-cell acute lymphocytic leukemia(B-ALL), Overall response rate (ORR)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of ORR (ORR = CR + CRi) at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of CAR-T cells to death or the last visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of CAR-T cells to the occurrence of any event, including death, relapse orgene relapse, disease progression (any one occurs first), and the last visit

secondary_outcome.measure: B cell non-hodgkin's lymphoma (B-NHL), Overall response rate (ORR)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of ORR (ORR = CR + PR) per Lugano 2014 criteria
Assessment of DCR (DCR=CR+PR+SD) per Lugano 2014 criteria
Assessment of Quality of life using Research and Treatment of Cancer QOL Core Questionnaire 30 (EORTC QLQ-30) at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12
Assessment of IADL score at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12
Assessment of ADL score at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12
Assessment of Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) score at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

arm_group.description: Dose escalation follows the standard 3+3 doseescalation design. A total of 3 dose levels are set for subjects.

intervention.description: Each subject receive CAR T-cells by intravenous infusion
Surgical catheter placement into the fourth ventricle of the brain

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital，College of Medicine, Zhejiang University
